title: Crisis In Agustria
opening: Verdane has fallen to Grannvale. On orders from Belhalla, Sigurd governs the region from Evans Castle, with his newly-wed wife Deirdre ever at his side.
However, Grannvale's actions in Verdane are ill received by neighboring Agustria. The lords of Agustria lead a storm of heated rhetoric denouncing Grannvale.

To make matters worse, the renowned pacifistic Agustrian ruler, King Imca, has been slain by an unknown hand. Imca's successor to the Agustrian crown is his firstborn son, Prince Chagall. Even as the Agustrian crisis unfolds, the bulk of Grannvale's army remains in Isaach.
And so, Chagall has given the lords his first command as their new king: invade Verdane. As the sole defender of Grannvale’s front, Sigurd once again finds himself in battle…

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: Lachesis, I'm leaving for Agusty. I can't rest until I've convinced King Chagall to end his foolish warmongering.

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: Please don't do it, brother! You know as well as I that Chagall murdered his father himself. You'll only be endangering yourself for a lost cause. He won't listen to you!

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: You mustn't say such things about your king! I, too, have heard the rumors of King Chagall's involvement, but they are just that: rumors. There remains no evidence against him. Surely, His Majesty will see reason in this matter, if I simply persuade him.

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: But-

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: Enough! I'll leave three of my finest knights here to defend Nordion, should the worst come to pass. Lachesis, you needn't look so sad. I will be back. I promise. I'm not about to abandon you in death.

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: Eldie…

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: Please, Your Majesty! Reconsider your militant ambitions. Your father before you worked so hard to build an era of peace with Grannvale. A war will only bring ruin to our people, bringing disgrace upon your good name for generations to come. I implore you: do not start a war!

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: So it's you... Eldigan of Nordion. You dastard... My father adored you, and you used his trust to undercut me at every turn. But now, my father is no more... And long live the king of all Agustria! For years you've made me play the fool, and now, I will reward you in kind. Guards! Throw this man in the dungeon!

intro.speaker: Eldigan
intro.line: W-wait! Your Majesty, please-

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: Pfeh! Good riddance, the eyesore. Send my orders to Bordeaux at Heirhein: seize Nordion Castle! Once that nuisance is dealt with, we're clear to throw all we've got at Grannvale!

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Your Majesty, King Chagall... I see you've made your decision at last.

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: Manfroy? Yes, just as we agreed. Father is dead, and by my hand. ...There is no turning back now. Even so, I still don't know if we stand a chance.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Remember, Grannvale still adheres to that tawdry old peace treaty with you, and their entire army is distracted in Isaach. Strike now, and you could not possibly fail.

intro.speaker: Chagall
intro.line: You're right. The downfall of Grannvale will mark the rise of Agustria as Jugdral's new leading power! "Chagall, Emperor of the World"... I like the sound of that.

intro.speaker: Manfroy
intro.line: Hmhmhm... We can only hope your ambition will be rewarded.

intro.speaker: Yves
intro.line: Milady! We've received word that Lord Eldigan was arrested in Agusty!

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: What?! You must be joking! Oh... Why didn't I try harder... I shouldn't have let him go...

intro.speaker: Yves
intro.line: That isn't our only problem, milady. With Lord Eldigan gone, we need to be aware of Heirhein's movements. Knowing of his lordships absence, a strike from them is inevitable. After the Verdane incident, they're most likely out for revenge on us... Especially Lord Elliot.

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: Ugh, that Elliot... I can't believe how many times I've had to tell him I'm not interested in him. Smug, self-absorbed swine like him are the absolute worst! If only more men were cut from the same cloth as Eldie... It's too bad they aren't, else perhaps someone would stand a chance to marry me. Perhaps.

intro.speaker: Yves
intro.line: Er... Be that as it may, Lord Eldigan's Cross Knights are still dispatched to the north at Fort Silvail, well away from here. We three are all who remain. Nordion is vulnerable, and they know it. Rest assured, my brothers and I will do all we can to defend the castle, but the odds are against us. I'm sorry, milady.

intro.speaker: Lachesis
intro.line: Very well. Thank you, Yves. But please, look after yourselves. Don't waste your lives for me. Be sure to tell Eva and Alva that I'm sorry for this.

intro.speaker: Yves
intro.line: We are not worthy of such kind words, milady. Even so, Lord Eldigan handpicked us to defend you. Our lord gave us a task, and we will see it through. As paladins of Nordion, our lives are yours, no matter what. To our dying breaths, we live to defend you!

intro.speaker: Bordeaux
intro.line: Let me get this straight. Eldigan ticked off the king and got himself a little prison time for his troubles? Ahahaha, that's perfect! Elliot! Lay siege to Nordion at once! Let's see some tears roll down Eldigan's Cheeks!

intro.speaker: Elliot
intro.line: With pleasure, Father!

intro.speaker: Oifey
intro.line: Sire, we have trouble! It appears that Lord Eldigan has been taken prisoner and Nordion is under attack. I bear a message from Lady Lachesis, pleading for aid.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: They've taken Eldigan?! Why... Why in the world would they treat a man so esteemed this way? Inform everybody to make ready. We ride for Nordion at once! No matter the cost, Lachesis needs us. He might never admit it, but Lachesis has always been dear to Eldigan. The loss of Lachesis would gravely wound him...

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: Milord... You're preparing for another battle, aren't you?

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: I'm sorry, Deirdre. I owe so much to Eldigan. I could never abandon his sister in a time like this.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: I thought as much. I'm not about to stop you. No... I will accompany you.

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: What?! No, I can't allow that! I refuse to endanger you like this.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: Milord, do you not remember our vows? You swore to never leave my side, and... I... I am... uneasy... I have a feeling that if you and I were to part, we would never find each other again... Please, grant me this. Let me stay by your side...

intro.speaker: Sigurd
intro.line: I'm sorry... you're right. I did promise. Very well! Let us ride together. But you mustn't leave my side.

intro.speaker: Deirdre
intro.line: I won't.

recruit-battle.speaker: Beowulf
recruit-battle.line: Don't take this personally, yeah? We've all gotta make a living...

recruit-battle.speaker: Erinys
recruit-battle.line: Listen carefully, Grannvale knight! Release Prince Lewyn immediately!

recruit-battle.speaker: Erinys
recruit-battle.line: Oh... Queen Rahna... I failed you... Forgive me…

recruit-battle.speaker: Erinys
recruit-battle.line: Prince Lewyn?! This can't be happening…

battle.speaker: Knight
battle.line: Sigh... Who in their right mind would want to be sent to this blasted outlook? To think that even at a time like this, I, the pride of the Agustrian ballisticians, am... Hm? Is somebody there?

battle.speaker: Knight
battle.line: Must've been the wind...

battle.speaker: Beowulf
battle.line: Hey, you! Wanna hire my blade? 10,000 gold. Take it or leave it. ...Right, deal. You ain't gonna be disappointed.

battle.speaker: Arden
battle.line: ...Sigh. I don't get it. No matter how hard I train or how strong I get, I'm still the butt of every joke 'round here. Maybe if I were more like Alec, with how he can attack twice... That'd be all I need to get a bit of respect, methinks... and maybe a cute lass while I'm at it... Hee hee. But I'm still just me... Back to the ol' grind, I suppose... Hang on? What's this little ring thing? Ooh, maybe it's one of those magical ones I keep hearing about. That'd be grand, wouldn't it? Let's try her on... Hm... Hwooooarh! W-what's this power I'm feeling?! IS this what Alec feels like all the time?

battle.speaker: Elliot
battle.line: Lady Lachesis of Nordion, huh... I've been looking forward to this. She's been playing cruel games with my heart for years... But look how the tables have turned! I've an entire army behind me, against her insignificant guard. What could she possibly do? She's powerless to resist coming back to Heirhein with me! And who knows... Perhaps one day she'll admit she wants it.

battle.speaker: Philip
battle.line: Our task is to form a defensive line. Don't let the enemy lure you from your post. Stand your ground! Understood?

battle.speaker: Macbeth
battle.line: So, Heirhein's finally made their move... Perfect. Release the brigands on the villages, as we arranged! Under the old king, you couldn't even dare to meddle in any of his property... Yet it is the easiest thing to cheat Chagall! Strip everything of worth you find and bring it back here. Leave no stone unturned!

battle.speaker: Clement
battle.line: Heirhein is going for Nordion's throat? Hm... who do I side with here? Let's wait and see how this unfolds. Instruct the men to remain where they are until the dust settles.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Heirhein is secure, sire. What are you thinking for our next move? Do we pull out?

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Hm. The imminent danger has passed. Nordion should be safe, but Eldigan is still being held in the capital. Furthermore...

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Yes?

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: I'm hearing that the frontier towns in the central forests are grappling with bandit raids. We can't afford to leave them be.

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Agreed. It is crucial that we help the locals, that we might convince them we aren't their enemy. In that case, we must ride for the north at once. There's no time to waste. Let's go!

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: You imbecile! You turned your back on this crisis to line your own pockets, and now we've lost Heirhein! There had better be a good explanation for your behavior, Macbeth!

battle.speaker: Macbeth
battle.line: Er, um... My humblest apologies, Your Majesty! Forgive me, I beg of you! I've already sent out the order for Waltz's sellsword unit to move in at once.

battle.speaker: Waltz
battle.line: Hrmph. There's the order to move in. Guess we don't 'ave much of a choice now. Bet he's gonna send us in, then 'ave his men turn tail right when we need 'em. I'm stayin' put till I see how this all plays out. Oi, Beowulf, how 'bout you?

battle.speaker: Beowulf
battle.line: Yeah, I ain't up for this at all, Waltz. That Macbeth swine really rubs me the wrong way. I'm this close to just walking off the job.

battle.speaker: Waltz
battle.line: You're a free man, Beowulf. If a job isn't right for you, you're free to quit it. That's the funny thing about mercenaries, innit? Today's pals are tomorrow's foes.

battle.speaker: Beowulf
battle.line: Amen to that. Hopefully we're not gonna end up enemies someday. Wouldn't have a hope in hell against you, would I?

battle.speaker: Waltz
battle.line: Heh... Ain't met anybody in the whole world who can take me!

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: What's going on, sir? What's that din outside?

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Well, well! The bard's still here, are you? You oughta get outta here. We've got bandits headed our way.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Bandits? Isn't the Agustrian army doing something about them?

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: The army? Hah! That's rich, boy! The army's too busy with their little civil war to deal with our problems. Clearly that's more important than our safety. Actually, that's not all... Rumor is, the Lord of Anphony himself is pullin' the bandits' strings here.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Oh, you've gotta be kidding. That's it. That guy's gotta go. I'll go sort out the bandits, okay? Now, how big a reward'll be waiting here for me when I get back?

battle.speaker: Man
battle.line: Still full of hot air, are you? Just get outta here, wise guy. Nobody here's got the time to listen to you blowing your own horn.

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Oh, come on! A little confidence would be nice! Eh, whatever...

battle.speaker: Silvia
battle.line: Oi! Lewyn! Runnin' off behind my back now, are ya?

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Silvia?! Damn! Er... I mean... you found me!

battle.speaker: Silvia
battle.line: Yeah, I found ya! You've had your fun with me, so you're just dumpin' me without so much as a goodbye?

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Hey, careful with that tongue of yours! We barely just met here a week ago! We've only been out for dinner for... What, two or three times? You're a dancer. I'm a bard... There's not much else to it.

battle.speaker: Silvia
battle.line: But... But you called me adorable! That... That really meant a lot to me...

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Er... Sometimes I just say things and don't really mean them... Oh, come on! Enough with the tears! Things'll probably get more than a bit rough out there, though. Think you'll be okay?

battle.speaker: Silvia
battle.line: Yeah! I like it rough!

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Geez... She was crying her eyes out just a few seconds ago. It's like she never really grew up...

battle.speaker: Silvia
battle.line: Huh?

battle.speaker: Lewyn
battle.line: Er, nothing! Let's get going.

battle.speaker: Erinys
battle.line: Oh, that must be Agusty Castle! I'd say we're due for a break. Hopefully we'll be able to find a lead on Prince Lewyn's whereabouts in town.

battle.speaker: Waltz
battle.line: Right, it's show time! Boys, you know the drill. Surrender ain't an option. Let's show 'em how real men fight!

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Sire, we have a visitor. Lord Filat of Belhalla seeks an audience.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Lord Filat, I presume? Thank you for coming.

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Lord Sigurd, the Agustrian conflict has escalated into full-scale war, I see. How does this battle look at the moment?

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: We're faring well so far, somehow, but this hasn't been easy by any means.

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Incidentally, Lord Sigurd, I regret to say that I come bearing bad news...

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: What's happened?

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Nasty rumors have emerged of late in the royal court... and they concern you. The rumors claim that, in concert with Quan of Leonster and Eldigan of Nordion, you are conspiring against the crown. This, it is said, is why you are harboring the prince of Isaach in your ranks.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: What?! That's absurd! Who in the world could've started such nonsense...

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Chancellor Reptor and Duke Langobalt.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: I see... I should have known, knowing their disdain for my father. Yet, to take that grudge so far...

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Those two are ruled by their envy of your father's immense power as Prince Kurth's advisor, I'd say. They likely believe a Chalphy-controlled prince will strip them of their influence once he takes the throne. Fear and jealousy dominate their lives... Don't let your guard down against them.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Thank you, sir. I appreciate the warning. By the way, sir... Pray tell, how goes the Isaachian campaign? Is there an end in sight?

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: It seems there is indeed, from what we've heard. We expect the triumphant return of the prince and your father any day now.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Thank the gods Prince Kurth is safe. Losing him to this war would have dealt such a blow to Grannvale's future... I know my father worries so about how the Belhalla lineage would end with His Majesty's death, unmarried as he is.

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Indeed. Before the war started, we were trying to hasten him to search for a wife.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: If I may, is there a problem?

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Indeed... The story behind this has been well known in the royal court for a long time now. Regrettable, His Highness struggles to move on from a long-lost love.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Really? Why did he never marry this person?

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Well... Perhaps I ought to tell you the complete tale. This happened some twenty years ago. Prince Kurth had an affair with the duchess of Velthomer, a truly lovely woman as I recall. Duke Victor of Velthomer was... Well, he was a philanderer of the worst degree, and had countless lovers. The prince, of course, is nothing like him. He wished only to support the duchess at first, but the two soon fell deeply in love. Victor was distraught, needless to say. He penned a letter denouncing the pair, then he took his own life. The duchess could bear to stay no longer. She fled Grannvale and was never seen again. As I recall, her name was Sigyn.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: ...Wow. That's horrible... So she was the mother of Lord Arvis...

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Indeed. I can scarcely imagine what this was like for him... Losing both parents at only the age of seven...

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Mm. And yet, I feel so sorry for the prince. Not to mention, for Sigyn as well...

battle.speaker: Filat
battle.line: Oh! My apologies. I'm sure a soldier of your caliber has better things to worry about than court gossip. Please, don't worry about the story. You have a war with Agustria to win, after all! Farewell, Lord Sigurd. We look forward to the day that you, too, return to the fatherland in triumph.

battle.speaker: Clement
battle.line: You can't be serious! They've come as far as Anphony?! Are they just going to keep going until all Agustria is theirs? They'll have to come this way. We've no choice but to fight. Deploy the ballistae. We're all that stands between the capital and Grannvale's dogs of war!

battle.speaker: Erinys
battle.line: King Chagall, with all due respect, may we begin already? I need to find Prince Lewyn as quickly as possible. You said you know his location. That's the only reason I'm here.

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: Apologies for the delay, knight, but I just received word of a lead for you. I trust you've noticed we're currently contending with a Grannvale invasion? They have taken Prince Lewyn captive! My scouts report that their army is arresting and executing anyone and anything which stands in their way. Your prince is being held in Evans Castle. Reports say that he is soon to face the axe.

battle.speaker: Erinys
battle.line: No... I can't allow this! Thank you for your assistance. We'll leave to rescue him at once. Our queen, Rahna, cautioned us against clashing with other nations on our mission, but we may have no choice. Should Grannvale's troops cross our way, they'll be confronted without hesitation.

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: Oho... This is even better than I'd hoped! Best of luck on your hunt.

battle.speaker: Erinys
battle.line: I'll be on my way, then.

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: She's gone... Pah! Stupid little girl. Ready the Agusty knights to deploy! End those pigs in a single strike!

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Good. Mackily is ours. That leaves the capital, Agusty…

battle.speaker: Oifey
battle.line: Indeed, sire, but don't get too careless. We've been informed that Agusty still hosts a sizable defensive force. We ought to take the most utmost care.

battle.speaker: Sigurd
battle.line: Mm, you're right. Who knows what Chagall has up his sleeve…

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: W-what?! Mackily has fallen too? Ugh... Zane! Your unit's our last line of defense. Take the field, immediately!

battle.speaker: Zane
battle.line: Y-yes, sir, but-

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: Cease your whining! Get out there!

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Chagall... So quick to panic at the first sign of trouble, are we?

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: Y-you! Manfroy!! If it weren't for your schemes, I wouldn't be in this mess! How in the blazes will you fix this?!

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Heh heh... You exaggerate my role. All I did was advise the removal of the king, obstacle to your ambition as he was. All else was your choice. Can you doubt this?

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: I... Damn it all! How is Sigurd's little army even this strong? This isn't fair! Manfroy, I'm begging you... Help me. What am I supposed to do now?!

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: As I said, this isn't over. As a last resort, I do believe you have a fellow of use imprisoned here... Yes, I speak of Eldigan. Eldigan and Sigurd have been associates for years. Sigurd will unquestionably listen to Eldigan's counsel. Of course, Eldigan can't do that while locked up, can he? Go apologize to him.

battle.speaker: Chagall
battle.line: Er... Y-yes, of course! Surely, Eldigan is the answer! Now, if you'll excuse me...

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Ugh... what a simpleton.

battle.speaker: Dark Mage
battle.line: Your Excellency, I bear news from the east. Just now, I bore witness to the assassination of Prince Kurth.

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Is that so? Excellent. This grows more interesting, if I do say so myself. With Kurth's death there remains but a single scion to Naga's holy lineage, and that old fool hardly needs our help to die. And then, all that will remain is the restoration of the dark one, and then the world will belong to us...

battle.speaker: Dark Mage
battle.line: What of Duke Arvis, Your Excellency? Is he in agreement with your plan?

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Why, of course. As a bearer of the dark one's blood, what choice does he have? Not even one of Arvis' stature can afford the wider world learning of his dark heritage, lest he be burned at the stake. Could a man as prideful as Arvis bear to meet such an end?

battle.speaker: Dark Mage
battle.line: So he will betray his king and style himself emperor, and...

battle.speaker: Manfroy
battle.line: Indeed... But that will not be enough. Arvis alone cannot restore the dark god. We still need one more person... That woman's daughter.

battle.speaker: Zane
battle.line: Men, move out! We may die here today, but we shall die in the fatherland's name!

end.speaker: Yves
end.line: Milady, we three shall return to Nordion. Before we leave, however, we have something for you. This ring will help you fight more like a mounted knight. Put it on and it will allow you to keep moving after fighting or healing. I know it will prove highly useful to you. Take care, milady!

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Deirdre?! Oh, thank the gods! You’re alright!

end.speaker: Deirdre
end.line: Mm. The enemy captured and imprisoned me, but I knew… I knew you would come for me, no matter what.

end.speaker: Oifey
end.line: Sire, King Chagall survived the battle, but he was badly wounded. He's currently being attended to by a royal priest.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: From what I heard, somebody pulled him from the battlefield when he was defeated. Who in the world would've done that...?

end.speaker: Eldigan
end.line: That was me, Sigurd. I rescued King Chagall. I preserved the life of the last survivor of the Agusty dynasty. No matter how unwise his decisions, no matter how ill his temper, I cannot sit in silence and allow my liege to die.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Hm? Eldigan?! You're safe! Thank the gods! I've been looking everywhere for you, since I heard you'd been arrested.

end.speaker: Eldigan
end.line: I suppose I was... But what is the meaning of this, Sigurd? Why is your army swarming the capital the first thing I found upon release? Why are reports saying our castles are now under the rule of Grannvale officers, as if we are a mere tributary state? I'm indisposed for barely any time at all, only to find Grannvale has made itself at home in Agustria behind my back! There had better be a damned good explanation for all of this, Sigurd, or there will be consequences.

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: I'm so sorry, Eldigan. You're absolutely right: none of this makes sense to me, either. As if out of nowhere, the entirety of Agustria suddenly turned against us. We had no choice. I've been ordered to remain here with my army for the time being, to maintain peace and order. Eldigan, please. I know this is a dreadful situation, but one year is all I need. I can restore the country's peace to normal and repair our diplomatic ties, but only if I'm allowed time to do it. Once our time is through, we'll leave your country with no objections. My king and I pledge our word.

end.speaker: Eldigan
end.line: Hm... I suppose I've little choice but to take you at your word. Very well: you have your year. I shall relocate the king to the northern Madino Castle for his own protection. I'll also leave my Cross Knights stationed at Fort Silvail. Offer even the slightest provocation, and your forces will have us to answer to. Remember, I'm holding you to your word. Break your promise, and we will break you. Do I make myself clear, Sigurd?

end.speaker: Sigurd
end.line: Of course. You know I'm not about to betray you. Please, Eldigan. You have to trust me!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: Anphony's Lord Macbeth is the foulest, most gold-obsessed man there is. He does nothin' but torment us for his own profit. I wish I could kill em' with my bare hands!

visit.speaker: Young Woman
visit.line: Hey, thanks for saving us! I want you to have this, one of my favorite things. It's a pretty little bracelet, huh? Wear it at the shops and the nice man there'll be happy to give ya a discount!

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: War's the most dreadful thing, and 'tis always the innocent and helpless who suffer most for it. Please... go home to your families.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: We can’t thank you enough for helpin’ us. This here sword’s the best we can do. It’s an unusual sword, innit? They call it an armorslayer. In the right hands it’ll cleave through the thickest armor. If your hands aren’t the right hands, though? Maybe it can make ya a quick buck at the pawn shop.

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Lord Eldigan is a sincere and righteous man, but alas, his sincerity's never been welcome to the ears of King Chagall. That's gotta be why he was locked up. Please, for the good of all Agustria... Help Lord Eldigan!

visit.speaker: Man
visit.line: The great Lord Eldigan of Nordion is a descendant of Hezul the Brave, one of the legendary Twelve Crusaders. He wields Hezul's old weapon, Mystletainn, the demon blade. They say it's as strong as Isaach's Balmung and Chalphy's Tyrfing... The three mightiest blades in all of creation.

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: The late King Imca was truly a great man. His sudden passing has been nothin' but devastating for us all. He's barely been buried for long and his son Chagall's already runnin' the country into the ground! If Lord Eldigan had a claim to the throne, somehow, then we wouldn't be in this mess…

visit.speaker: Woman
visit.line: Psst! Wanna hear something saucy? Y’know how Lord Eldigan has a li’l sister, right? Well, lookin’ at ‘em, wouldn’t ya say there’s more to it than that? If you know what I mean… Ohoho! I love me a li’l bit of gossip! Hmm? I’ve better things to do than run me mouth, y’say? Fine, then.

visit.speaker: Young Man
visit.line: There's still gotta be descendants of the dark lord Loptyr livin' somewhere, right? Folk in the big cities like Agusty an' Mackily certainly seem to think so. Every year they do these huge hunts for Loptyr's spawn. They arrest a ton of people, then burn 'em all at the stake, even if they're innocent... Madness, I tell ya!

visit.speaker: Old Man
visit.line: Beware of Bishop Clement, the lord of Mackily Castle. That dastard wields a magical staff that they call a Sleep staff. If you're not careful, you'll find yourself snoozin' and wide open to bein' attacked.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lachesis
recruit-talk.line: Sir Sigurd! Thank goodness you're here! Things were looking so bleak for a moment...

recruit-talk.speaker: Sigurd
recruit-talk.line: I'm glad to see you're safe, Lachesis. What about Eldigan? Is he still being held?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lachesis
recruit-talk.line: Yes, he's still in Agusty... It's as if all the lords of Agustria have turned on us. Please, Sir Sigurd... Lend us your might. No matter what it takes, my brother must be saved.

recruit-talk.speaker: Sigurd
recruit-talk.line: Of course. I've no fondness for bringing war to foreign lands, but in this case we've little choice. His Majesty, King Azmur, is aware of King Imca's assassination, and of Chagall's hand in it. He's received word of Chagall's ambitions to invade Grannvale itself, and has already approved military action. His Majesty also believes Eldigan's rescue to be vital if we're to put an end to hostilities. Rest assured, Lachesis. I swear that I'll save Eldigan…

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Wait... Erinys?! The hell are you doing here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Huh? Aren't you... ...It can't be! Prince Lewyn?! ...What exactly are you wearing, milord?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: What, this? I'm a bard now. You know, walking the land, spreading songs and cheer? What do you say: perfect, or perfect?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Er... Perfect? But why, milord... Aren't you supposed to be held captive at Evans? I got here as fast as I could, but...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: I'm imprisoned at Evans, am I? Where'd you hear that one?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: King Chagall of Agustria said so.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Chagall? Hah! Hate to break it to you, Erinys, but you've been tricked! It's nice and all that you're so ready to trust, but you wouldn't last ten seconds out there in the city! It'd eat you and your innocence alive. You might even end up like Silvia...

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Silvia, milord...?

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Oh, Silvia's... Er, it's not important. Point is, what are you doing all the way out here?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Isn't it obvious? I'm here to find and bring you home, milord. It's been two years since you fled Silesse. Her Majesty is gravely worried about you. Please, milord. Come home with me.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Do you have any idea what that'd do to Silesse, Erinys? If I go back, I'll have no choice but to take the throne. It's my late father's will, but my uncles would never accept it. Just one false step and we'd have a civil war, just like here. And it's always the common folk who suffer for it! If there are people who want to be kings or whatever, great! Out here, though? I'm free, and I like it that way. I don't want a thing to do with that throne. For the good of Silesse, just give it to one of my uncles.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: I can't allow that, milord. You know as well as I that the kings of Silesse must bear descent from Forseti, the wind god. You, milord, are the sole living scion of his lineage. Neither of your uncles bear it. You milord, are Silesse's future! Yourself and your uncles aside, all Silesse wishes to see you claim the throne. And... And your mother, the queen, was in tears when she sent me... Please, milord... Come back.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Erinys... Ugh, don't you start crying too! Give me a break... I can't stand to see a woman in tears... Okay, fine. I'll think about going home. Just... Give me some time to muster the nerve, alright?

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Thank you. In that case, I'm staying with you until you're ready, milord. I'll send a messenger back to Silesse to report that you're safe.

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Wow, you're persistent, I'll grant you that. All right. I think I'll stay with Sigurd's army for now. He's a pretty neat guy to work with, not to mention his army's full of beauties! Hey, Erinys, you could stand to get to know some of the ladies here. Maybe their stylishness could rub off on you a bit!

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Yes, milord...

recruit-talk.speaker: Lewyn
recruit-talk.line: Hey, I'm just kidding, Erinys! Relax a bit! Don't take everything so seriously! ...Heh, nobody in the world's as sweet as you. Don't you ever change a thing.

recruit-talk.speaker: Erinys
recruit-talk.line: Y-yes, sir... I mean, no, milord…

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: How are you faring so far, Deirdre? I know my brother is worried something fierce about you risking your life like this.

battle-talk.speaker: Deirdre
battle-talk.line: Ethlyn...? Thank you for asking, but I'm doing just fine for now. Everything will be alright. I can feel it. So long as I'm at Sigurd's side, our happiness will see us through.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: I don't think I've ever seen Sigurd as happy as he's been since he met you. He's practically a changed man!

battle-talk.speaker: Deirdre
battle-talk.line: Ethlyn... Here. I'd like you to have this. I've been meaning to give it to you for a while.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: Oh? ...Is- is this a light brand?! Wow... These are so rare and hard to come by! Are you sure you want to give me this?

battle-talk.speaker: Deirdre
battle-talk.line: Of course. I know that it will serve you well.

battle-talk.speaker: Ethlyn
battle-talk.line: I can't thank you enough, Deirdre! I'll always treasure it!

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Hey! Lachesis! There y'are! Check out this little beauty of a sword! Thought I'd give it to ya.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Oh? I can't say I've seen a blade so peculiar before. Does it have a name?

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: It's called a thief's sword. Wanna gut the bad guys? This thing's yer best friend.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Er... Thank you. Although, why are you giving this to me? I'm hardly complaining, but surely you need a decent sword?

battle-talk.speaker: Dew
battle-talk.line: Nah, I'm not bothered. There ain't any point in me keeping it. Let's just say it does a lot more than just stab... Heh. See ya around!

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Finn, these Agustrians are proving to be far worthier opponents than the thugs of Verdane, wouldn't you say? For stronger enemies, what could be more fitting than a stronger weapon? Let's see how you fare with this.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: Is that... a brave lance?! Are you sure you want to entrust me with such a rarity?

battle-talk.speaker: Quan
battle-talk.line: Of course. You are House Leonster's most promising young knight. You are our future, and I'd sooner see you live this day. Arming you properly is the best I can do to help for now, so yes. Take this spear.

battle-talk.speaker: Finn
battle-talk.line: What an honor, milord! Thank you.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Lewyn, I presume? The one who's been helping defend the villages? I appreciate the aid. As I understand it, you're a bard, but you also wield magic? That's unusual.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Something like that. I guess it's a hobby. You're that Sigurd fellow, aren't you? It's obvious what your little hobby is: war! Clearly you've got so much spare time, you spend it starting war after war!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Come again? You seem angry, but-

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Don't play dumb! Think about the people of all the countries that you're flattening! You come barging in, swords flashing, and all you do is ruin the lives of normal folk who're trying to make a living here!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: You're right. My apologies, Lewyn... I didn't even think about that, but I can't stand knowing I've done this to them.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Words are just words without actions backing them up. If you really feel so bad, then why not pull your army out?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Mm, you're right... Very well. I'll consult with my troops and arrange a retreat.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Wait, you're serious about this?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Of course. I've been mulling over retreating for a while already, and you just gave me the answer to all of this. I've had enough of the war approach. I think I'd rather seek a diplomatic answer.

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Yeah, no. Trying to get through to Chagall now would be a total waste of everyone's time. Besides, if you lot pull out now, then nothing stands between a peeved king and all the citizens who've helped you so far. Are you sure you're okay with leaving them all hanging like that?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Well, no, but... Er... I…

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Ahahaha! Y'know, I guess I was wrong about you. You're alright, Sigurd. Say, why don't I help you finish this fight up?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Er... Okay, I suppose... Who are you, anyway?

battle-talk.speaker: Lewyn
battle-talk.line: Who, me? I'm just a wayward troubadour, my friend…

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Hey! You're Silvia, aren't you? Excuse me for being so forward, but you're adorable!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Finally! Here I was, thinkin' this army's nothin' but stiff and borin' military types. It's about time someone appreciated me!

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Heh, I guess I'm the only decent guy around here. Glad I found you.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Thanks! Me, too!

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: I guess we'll be here a while, so how about dinner sometime? Bet that'd be nice.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Ooh, yeah! Maybe I'll dance for you too! I've got a special one that nobody's seen yet. It's kinda embarrassing, 'cause it's VERY special. Maybe I'll show it to ya, though!

battle-talk.speaker: Alec
battle-talk.line: Y-you will? Oh, I can't wait!

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Eee! It's the great Lord Sigurd!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Er... Hello, there? You're a dancer, right? The battlefield is too dangerous for the likes of you. Go back to the castle.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Come on, sir! Don'tcha know who I am? I'm Silviaaaaaaa! You can call me Silvie if ya want, though!

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Look, I'm sorry, but I really don't have the time to look after children. Be a good little girl and run along back to the castle, alright?

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Rrrgh... Good little girl?! Look at me! How d'you look at someone this hot and think "little girl"?! What is wrong with you? Never thought ya'd be such a borin' old stiff, just like everyone else 'round here...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Enough! I have work to do.

battle-talk.speaker: Silvia
battle-talk.line: Sigh... Oh, well. Back to being a lone, delicate flower, sprouting in a battlefield... My beauty is nothing to the tide of bodies...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Ugh... What in the world is…

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Hey, you! You're that Nordion lady, aren't ya?

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: E-excuse me?! Such boorishness! What manner of lowlife is asking?

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Oh, er, sorry 'bout that, ma'am. The name's Beowulf, a hired blade.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: What do you want?

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Uh... Well, I just wanted to give ya a quick heads up about fightin'. See, war ain't the fun and games you're used to. And someone as green as you... Well, you're gonna get in the way. Besides, a princess's a princess. Why not run along back to your castle now?

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: H-how dare you! My business in battle is just that: my business! Not yours! I'll nail your foul mouth closed!

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Heh. You really are Eldigan's sister. Shoulda known you wouldn't be a pushover.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: What's that? Do you know my brother?!

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Oh, yeah. Eldigan and me, we go way back. I'd never've been so noisy if he hadn't asked me to keep an eye on ya.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Is that so? Oh, I'm sorry for snapping at you so.

battle-talk.speaker: Beowulf
battle-talk.line: Eh, I've seen a lot worse in me time. Hey, how about a quick battle lesson? Eldigan thought it'd be a big help.

battle-talk.speaker: Lachesis
battle-talk.line: Why, thank you. I'd like that.

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Lord Sigurd, I presume?

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: I am indeed. And you, madam?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: My name is Erinys. I'm a royal knight of Silesse. I wish to join your army, so as to keep an eye on Prince Lewyn.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Er... Prince Lewyn? What are you on about?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: My lord Lewyn is the rightful heir to the Silessian crown. He is a scion of Ced, the Wind Crusader, and is the sole inheritor of his power.

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Wait, THAT Lewyn?! Heh... I knew there was something odd about him, but I'd never have thought him to be Silessian royalty. Any idea why he's pretending to be a bard?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: That's a long story, sir, and I'm hardly the most qualified to tell it. Perhaps try asking him later, but for now...

battle-talk.speaker: Sigurd
battle-talk.line: Fair enough. It's hardly my business, anyway. I'm glad you're here, Erinys. A pegasus knight among us would be a great help. Would you mind aiding us in battle?

battle-talk.speaker: Erinys
battle-talk.line: Yes, sir! I'll do my part!

boss.speaker: Chagall
boss.line: Tch... Don't even think about underestimating me. You don't stand a chance of besting me!

boss.speaker: Chagall
boss.line: Urgh... No, w-wait! Spare me! Please…

boss.speaker: Zane
boss.line: Grannvale's dogs stand no chance in the face of my warrior's pride! I'll put an end to your rampage!

boss.speaker: Zane
boss.line: No... Is this... the beginning of the end... for Agustria…

boss.speaker: Chagall
boss.line: Eldigan's little sister? What do you think you're doing, defying your king like this?!

boss.speaker: Lachesis
boss.line: I'd sooner bow to a festering pig than call you my king! Return my brother! Now!

boss.speaker: Chagall
boss.line: Heh heh... So, it's you again. You've finally realized, have you? Ignorant wench.

boss.speaker: Erinys
boss.line: How dare you, Chagall! You'll pay dearly for deceiving me! Prepare yourself!!
